channel.title: Woodlands Historic Park - Coleoptera
channel.description: Beetles photographed at Woodlands Historic Park

item.title: Liparetrus spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Three photos uploaded. This one looks different to the other Liparetrus spp. seen here.

item.title: Selagis aurifera aurifera
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Selagis aurifera, I think, see: https://sites.google.com/site/buprestidpages/selagis

item.title: Eupoecila australasiae
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Seven photos uploaded

item.title: Cleridae spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Clerid beetle, not sure of ID...

item.title: Unidentified
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Longicorn beetle, still looking for an ID match...

item.title: Neorrhina punctatum
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Quite a few of these buzzing around the floweing Bursaria spinosa.

item.title: Neorrhina punctatum
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Mating pair

item.title: Haplonyx spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Haplonyx sp., can you please add it to the database

item.title: Isacantha dermestiventris
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: I'm pretty sure this is Isacantha dermestiventris, currently not in the database.

item.title: Hippodamia variegata
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Lots of these around Melbourne at the moment.

item.title: Dicranolaius spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Similar to Dicranolaius bellulus

item.title: Macrones spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Four photos added. Black wasp-mimic longicorn, about 5cm long. It has been suggested via a Facebook group that this is Macrones exilis. Looks right to me, but there are some similar species. https://apps2.cdfa.ca.gov/publicApps/plant/bycidDB/wdetails.asp?id=20012&w=o

item.title: Arsipoda spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Small (estimate 4mm) shiny blue beetle.

item.title: Lepidopteryx spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Bark beetle, Lepidopteryx sp., please add to database. Three photos added.

item.title: Eleale simplex
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: I'm fairly sue that this is Eleale simplex - see http://www.bowerbird.org.au/observations/48218

item.title: Aporocera (Aporocera) haematodes
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: 4 photos uploaded

item.title: Paropsis atomaria, Paropsisterna variicollis
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: two of the most common species of leaf beetles on adjacent leaves of a Sugar Gum

item.title: Cadmus (Cadmus) crucicollis
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: Less than 10mm long. On Eucalyptus camaldulensis leaf

item.title: Arsipoda spp., Myoporum insulare
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: There were large numbers of these very small beetles on the Myoporum insulare on Providence Road adjacent to Woodlands Historic Park. (These were planted by the council and do not occur in the Park.) I believe the enlarged hind femur identifies it as a flea beetle, tribe Alticini, which narrows it down to one of 232 species according to AFD

item.title: Chrysomelidae spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: There were many of these tiny acacia leaf beetle larvae on an Acacia pycnantha. Possibly Calomela sp.

item.title: Diphucrania spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Small Diphucrania sp. jewel beetle, much smaller than others I've seen.

item.title: Paropsis spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Leaf beetle larvae. I haven't seen this variety before. Also posted on BowerBird.

item.title: Unidentified
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Maybe a type of darkling beetle?? Three photos uploaded.

item.title: Paropsisterna fastidiosa
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Leaf beetle larvae on a grey box sapling.

item.title: Rhinophthalmus nasutus
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: I think this is a Rhinopthalmus sp. I Can't find any more info to get an exact species. Three photos uploaded.

item.title: Callidemum hypochalceum
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: There were many of these beetles on Dodonea viscosa plants, none feeding but a few mating. The photo might be useless for ID but I though the colours were pretty!

item.title: Dicranosterna immaculata
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: 3 photos of beetle about 10mm long. Have not had time to try to id. It was on Acacia dealbata.

item.title: Paropsis spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: According to Martin Lagerwey (via Bowerbird), this is either P. variolosa or P. lownei (these two are indistinguishable visually).

item.title: Trachymela spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Trachymela sp.??

item.title: Dicranosterna immaculata
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Acacia leaf beetle larvae

item.title: Gonipterus spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: A few of these on grass stems, possibly recently emerged. Eucalyptus weevil, Gonipterus sp., possibly Gonipterus scutellatus.

item.title: Unidentified
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Freshly hatched eaf beetle larvae, I suspect they're Paropsis atomaria

item.title: Paropsisterna beata
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: A few of these larvae crawling around. About 6 adults present as well. Same location as last sighting on 23/12/17

item.title: Trachymela spp.
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: Leaf beetle on yellow box sapling.

item.title: Leptopius spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Leptopius sp. two photos uploaded, side and top-down views

item.title: Trachymela spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Four photos uploaded.

item.title: Chrysomelidae spp., Paropsisterna spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Leaf beetle, I haven't been able to narrow it down, ID help appreciated.

item.title: Trachymela spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Leaf beetle, I haven't been able to narrow it down, ID help appreciated.

item.title: Paropsisterna beata
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: I counted 17 individuals of these leaf beetles actively crawling all over a large gum tree, with a few pairs mating. There were also some black eggs laid in formation on several leaves of the same tree, possibly from this species. Five photos uploaded.

item.title: Dicranolaius bellulus
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Small colourful beetle, actively climbing on sheoak

item.title: Coccinellidae spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Ladybird larva, I think

item.title: Paropsisterna fastidiosa
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Paropsisterna fastidiosa, ID by Martin Lagerwey via BowerBird

item.title: Paropsis spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Maybe Paropsis atomaria?

item.title: Calomela ioptera
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: Acacia leaf beetle with its petticoat showing?

item.title: Rhinotia suturalis
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Two individuals seen near each other.

item.title: Eleale spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Clerid beetle roosting on a sheoak, probably Eleale sp.

item.title: Calomela parilis
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: This small leaf beetle was shiny and golden/green in colour in natural sunlight.

item.title: Calomela ioptera
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Far more colourful than the photos shown, shiny and iridescent.

item.title: Rhinotia spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Quite a lot of these around this afternoon, some flying, others on various wattle species, probably about 30 induviduals seen.

item.title: Liparetrus spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Small, approximately 1cm long

item.title: Mordellidae spp., Xerochrysum viscosum
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: Pin tailed beetles on inflorescence of Xerochrysum viscosa (Sticky Everlasting). The beetles are only a few mm long.

item.title: Rhinotia spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: About 10 of these seen on the same wattle. I think R. hemisticta, but a lot of the belid weevils looks similar...

item.title: Coleoptera spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: A lot of these small beetles seen today, approximately 5mm long, all seen on black wattle (I think, my plant ID is not up to scratch)

item.title: Monolepta spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: A few of these small beetles seen today, approximately 5mm long, all seen on black wattle (I think, my plant ID is not up to scratch)

item.title: Chrysomelidae spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Leaf beetle larvae

item.title: Homotrysis cisteloides
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Quite a few of these around this morning, maybe 10-15 individuals, all on small Eucalyptus. ID from Bron King via Facebook Amateur Entomology Australia group.

item.title: Chalcopteroides spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Five of these beetles seen on Eucalyptus trunks, around 15mm to 20mm with a slight green shine to them

item.title: Unidentified
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Maybe Cadmus sp.?

item.title: Unidentified
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Quite a few (maybe 15) of these small beetles (<1cm) flying around, low to the ground.

item.title: Castiarina bifasciata
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: On Bursaria spinosa blossom

item.title: Melobasis spp.
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: Feeding on Bursaria spinosa blossom

item.title: Liparetrus spp.
item.dc:creator: triplett
item.description: Seen eating eucalypt leaf

item.title: Paropsisterna fastidiosa
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Paropsisterna fastidiosa, ID by Martin Lagerwey via BowerBird

item.title: Peltoschema suturalis
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: On Acacia melanoxylon

item.title: Leptopius spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Large-ish weevil

item.title: Cadmus spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: I think this might be Cadmus aurantiacus but I can't find any more photos online (see photo on page two http://plantationhealth.com.au/pdf/pestnotes/cadmus.pdf)

item.title: Unidentified
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Small, fast moving, shiny golden beetle

item.title: Coccinellidae spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Ladybird chrysalis, found on sheoak (Allocasuarina verticillata). About 4 chyrsalis found, along with about 6 larvae see: http://natureshare.org.au/observations/58e59bf7ed2a894865000af0

item.title: Coccinellidae spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Ladybird larvae, unsure of species. Found on sheoak (Allocasuarina verticillata). About 6 larvae found as well as 4 chyrsalis see: http://natureshare.org.au/observations/58e59c8bed2a893432000005

item.title: Cryptolaemus montrouzieri
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: I have absolutely no idea what these are. There were about 20 of them, approximately 1cm long, crawling around on a silver wattle.

item.title: Paropsis atomaria
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Leaf beetle larvae, continuing observation. Paropsis atomaria ID via facebook Amatuer Entomololgy Australia group. See https://natureshare.org.au/observations/58cbb39ced2a89904c000003?collection_id=585e00cded2a89748000ace8 and https://natureshare.org.au/observations/58c36d0fed2a893890003cc7?collection_id=585e00cded2a89748000ace8

item.title: Paropsis atomaria
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Paropsis atomaria ID via facebook Amatuer Entomololgy Australia group. Ongoing observation: https://natureshare.org.au/observations/58c36d0fed2a893890003cc7?collection_id=585e00cded2a89748000ace8 and https://natureshare.org.au/observations/58d38046ed2a896341000e50

item.title: Paropsisterna variicollis
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Leaf beetle larvae, likely the same as these ones on another part of the same tree: https://natureshare.org.au/observations/58c373b4ed2a893890003d00

item.title: Paropsisterna variicollis
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Leaf beetle larvae, likely the same as these ones on another part of the same tree: https://natureshare.org.au/observations/58c3745fed2a893890003d07

item.title: Paropsis atomaria
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Tiny, freshly hatched leaf beetle larvae. Paropsis atomaria ID via facebook Amatuer Entomololgy Australia group. Observed 6 days later: https://natureshare.org.au/observations/58cbb39ced2a89904c000003 and 12 days later: https://natureshare.org.au/observations/58d38046ed2a896341000e50

item.title: Diphucrania spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Diphucrania sp., I think. Far more shiny, golden, and beautiful than the photos show. It climbed up to the top of a leaf and flew away before I could get more photos.

item.title: Ancita spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Seemed quite interested in a large gall

item.title: Paropsisterna variicollis
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Maybe Paropsisterna sp.? Edit: Paropsisterna variicollis ID via BowerBird

item.title: Gonipterus spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Probably Gonipterus scutellatus

item.title: Rhinotia suturalis
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Seen on Acacia paradoxa. Maybe Rhinotia suturalis

item.title: Rhinotia spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: There were type types of Rhinotia sp. weevils around this morning. The ones with white markings on their back I think are Rhinotia hemisticta. The plain ones, like this, to my eyes seem to have slightly 'fatter' front legs, although they may also be Rhinotia hemisticta. I don't know if this variablility is within the same species or denotes a different species.

item.title: Rhinotia spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Quite a few of these around this morning, at least 20 seen around the place. Looks like Rhinotia hemisticta to me, but not certain.

item.title: Rhinotia spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Weevil with large-ish front legs. It dropped to the ground when it saw me, I only managed two photos

item.title: Syllitus rectus
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Looks very similar to this observation https://natureshare.org.au/observations/583d544bed2a89ee390000ac?display=list&order_by=created_at&user_id=Andrew_Allen idenitified by David Francis, but this one looked much smaller.

item.title: Hoshihananomia spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: I originally had these as Hoshihananomia leucosticta, but now I'm not so sure, the markings don't look quite right

item.title: Phyllotocus macleayi macleayi
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: At least 100 of these seen in many flowering gums, all of them mating, most of them with their heads burried deep in the flowers.

item.title: Coleoptera spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Unidentified beetle

item.title: Stenoderus suturalis
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Quite a few of these longicorn beetles on this floweing shrub

item.title: Calomela satelles
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Some type of leaf beetle????

item.title: Porrostoma rhipidium
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Lycid beetle

item.title: Orthorhinus cylindrirostris
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Well camouflaged weevil.

item.title: Carphurus spp.
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Unsure of where to start with an ID for this one... rove beetle??

item.title: Ecnolagria grandis
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Darkling beetle, Ecnolagria grandis, I think. Quite a lot of these today at Woodlands Historic Park, maybe 30 or more.

item.title: Eleale pulcher
item.dc:creator: andrew_allen
item.description: Clerid beetle
